page.title: 08Cereals & Potatoes in Felton
page.content: Potatoes are grown as the main crop on about thirty hectares in about four different varieties and sold to the fish and chip store outlets. They are planted in April and sprayed for the control of blight. Approximately 17 hectares are irrigated in the dry season. They are harvested mechanically during October. There are a wide range of cereals grown in the area, particularly as the Government Experimental Farm tests and experiments with many different varieties and growing conditions. The heavier yielding winter barley is taking over from the spring barley. Winter wheat is grown on about 200 hectares. About 15 hectares of winter oats act as a break crop before wheat. Oil seed rape is grown only at Rosemaund on an experimental basis.
